summary:
I am an adventurous and curious individual that is driven by discovery, growth, and making a contribution to life. I enjoy research and development and in the past this led me to pursue a PhD (Center for Wave Phenomena at Colorado School of Mines) and a postdoc (Princeton University) in seismology, and a career in various roles in the oil and gas industry, the most recent being a research manager in Rio de Janeiro in Brazil, where I setup an R&D team of 5 local contract researchers and developers from the ground up.

Nowadays, it is obvious that artificial intelligence (AI) and new developments in computation will fundamentally change the way we live in the coming decades. Meanwhile, due to the ongoing move towards sustainable energy, the oil industry will be faced with increased price pressure in the long term. In my current position, the aim is to benefit from new developments in AI and computation to improve cost-efficiency in subsurface technology for the exploration and monitoring of natural resources. 

When not working I can be found on my bike, in/on/near the water, or making music.

profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description: Built a research group with 4 Brazilian (local contract) researchers and 1 developer from the ground up. Setup a research program for the group as well as a collaboration with Delft University of Technology. The research and development aimed mostly at making an impact on imaging and reservoir characterisation for pre-salt reservoirs offshore Brazil. Topics included Marchenko imaging with internal multiples, seismic reservoir characterisation (forward modelling and inversion) that accounts for illumination variations using Point Spread Functions, dynamic warping of seismic data based on an eikonal solver, 3D isotropic fast-marching eikonal solver, and hybrid finite-frequency traveltime and waveform inversion (i.e. full waveform inversion using both travel times and amplitudes). Helped change the culture at the Rio center from a lower tech to a higher-tech processing shop through close collaboration with the production group, organising a technical seminar, establishing a presence at local and international conferences through writing of conference abstracts, teaching presentation skills, helping with the hiring of new seismic processors as well as all technical-related management of the center, and challenging the status quo. The focus was on leading by example. Prepared and gave several well-received presentations at Petrobras on various R&D topics, including an invited talk on envisioning the future of seismic technology in 2040 at a workshop organised by Petrobras. The talk was recognised as the best presentation of the workshop.
profile_positions.title: Research Manager

profile_positions.description: Research and development on various topics, including (but not limited to) finite-frequency travel time tomography (aka full-waveform inversion with travel times), adjoint-state methods, semblance-based interval VTI parameter estimation, surface-wave (Rayleigh and Love wave) forward modelling and inversion, surface-wave removal,   seismic interferometry, eikonal tomography and vibrator ground-motion analysis. Many conference abstracts and presentations as well as publications in peer-reviewed international journals. Work was done remotely from Princeton University.
profile_positions.title: Senior research geophysicist

profile_positions.description: Research and development on various topics, including (but not limited to) finite-frequency travel time tomography (aka full-waveform inversion with travel times), adjoint-state methods, semblance-based interval VTI parameter estimation, surface-wave (Rayleigh and Love wave) forward modelling and inversion, surface-wave removal,   seismic interferometry, eikonal tomography and vibrator ground-motion analysis. Many conference abstracts and presentations as well as publications in peer-reviewed international journals. Work was done remotely from Princeton University.
profile_positions.title: Research geophysicist

profile_positions.description: See work description for work done while at ION Geophysical, as I was working for ION remotely as a visitor in the seismology group from Jeroen Tromp at Princeton. Studying adjoint state method and adjoint-based tomography. Participation in weekly seismology seminar and other on-campus seminars.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Scientist

profile_positions.description: Research on seismic interferometry and representation theorems for perturbed media, adjoint-based tomography, and non-linear regularisation techniques for seismic tomography in the wavelet domain. Collaboration with Ignace Loris, Ingrid Daubechies, Tony Dahlen and Guust Nolet in the geomath group.
profile_positions.title: Hess research fellow

profile_positions.description: Worked mostly on testing of curvelet-based (leading-order) pre-stack time-migration, one of the results from my PhD studies at the Center for Wave Phenomena at Colorado School of Mines.
profile_positions.title: 2 month internship in Advanced Imaging group

profile_positions.description: Developed analytic expressions for pre--stack map time-migration and de-migration that allowed analytic (and thus fast) calculation of migrated and de-migrated positions, times and slopes. The developed equations removed the need for numerical optimization and thus allowed a significant speed-up of such map migration. Some assistance with dual-sensor summation software development.
profile_positions.title: Research geophysicist

profile_positions.description: Tended to various projects that needed special care beyond normal processing contractual needs. Amongst others the  processing sequence in 4D time-lapse processing was analyzed to identify the main steps in the processing sequence that were key in reducing 4D noise. This led to recommendations for improved 4D processing procedures.
profile_positions.title: Staff geophysicist

profile_positions.description: Multicomponent (4C) data processing: data pre-processing, denoising, receiver repositioning, dual-sensor summation, receiver repositioning and re-orientation, multi-component coupling correction, Alford rotation, DMO, various methods of post-stack migration, some pre-stack Kirchhoff migration testing. Implemented the mirror-summation method for dual-sensor summation at a client's request and presented results to the client to convince the clients of its proper working. Explained and educated others on the workings and the pros and cons of dual-sensor summation. Marketing talk at Utrecht University to get people excited about starting a career as a field seismic analyst.
profile_positions.title: Seismic analyst

profile_positions.description: Field seismic analyst working on both streamer and OBC vessels. Besides normal responsibilities of QC'ing the data, I co-developed (at our own initiative and outside of normal working hours) a company-first website for an acquisition vessel, allowing people in the office to see JPEGs from the QC products made on-board. This allowed people in the office a next-day view of some QC products, instead of waiting 2 months to load the tapes after a crew-change.
